text: William Conrad Costin, MC (19 May 1893; 6 October 1970)'Dr W C Costin' The Times Wednesday, Oct. 7, 1970 Issue 57990 p.10 was President of St John's College, Oxford from 1957'Dr W C Costin' The Times Wednesday, Oct. 7, 1970 Issue 57990 p.10 to 1963. Costin was educated at Reading SchoolOld Redingensians and St John's College, Oxford. He served in the Great War with the Gloucestershire Regiment. He was Proctor of Oxford University in 1935 He wrote: 'Great Britain and China, 1833–1860', 1937; 'The Law and Working of the Constitution: Documents, 1660–1914', 1952; and 'History of St John’s College, 1598–1860', 1958.British Library web site accessed 11:47 GMT Thursday 7th May, 2020 ==References== Category:People educated at Reading School Category:1893 births Category:1970 deaths Category:Alumni of St John's College, Oxford Category:Presidents of St John's College, Oxford Category:Gloucestershire Regiment officers
title: William Costin (academic)
